data.content: When you start playing this game it's great fun - there are new Pokemon all over the place, moving around is a voyage of discovery and you're constantly levelling-up. However after you've been playing the game for a while it just becomes more and more of a grind... Catching Pokemon becomes more difficult, finding new ones becomes a rarity, it takes hundreds of thousands of points to level-up, powering your Mons takes insane amounts of work and you walk miles and miles to hatch the same old things. As said elsewhere, battling in gyms seems unrewarding. Also, if you're not near a gym or a nest there is basically nothing you can do. It would be good if the game found some way to reward persistent players instead of penalising them; and it would be good if you could do something with your Pokemon that didn't require you to be in a gym.
data.title: Ever-diminishing returns

data.content:
Game a little boring now, always same old Pokémon about, gym battles rarely happen since change back gyms near my work haven't change hands in over a month, waiting for next faddy update.

The game is fun, more so in the early stages but game has been out a while and there are still some major bugs not being fixed.  Halloween edition was great they fixed the distance tracker but it's now worse you need to walk a 1 MILE to register 1km

Biggest bug is for a walking game the distance tracker is way off in a few tests, walking 1km round 400 metre track recorded 0.45km, running a 5k park run with app open recorded 2.8km, whilst also running run keeper which got the distance spot on, the bug has been reported but they don't fix or have it as known problem as incubator sales would likely drop.

Big bug two, battles drain your battery super quick, each gym attack champion will eat about 5% of battery meaning clearing a level 3 gym can use 25% of battery.

Bug 3 tracking hasn't been improved since the first month of the game and is hardly worth checking unless you want to be frustrated

data.content:
If all you want is to catch Pokemon then you'll be happy. If however, you want to take part in the multiplayer (gym) aspect, don't bother. Too many spoofers, botters and cheaters to have an interesting experience. Which wouldn't be too bad, if not for Niantic's refusal to police anything other than the bots, which can't be beaten anyway. 

The complete lack of a response, let alone action regarding multiple reports against confirmed spoofers is more than enough reason to have no faith in the developers.

The only reason this is not a 1-star review is because the single player element is good enough.

data.content: I love the concept of this game but sadly a few points really hold it back. Back when it first started you would find all sorts of Pokemon in gyms, but now it's only ever one of four or five Pokemon - Dragonite, Gyarados, Snorlax, Vaporeon and Lapras. It makes gyms incredibly boring and actually limits the amount of Pokemon you actually care about catching. Once you've got the pokedex completed there's no reason to catch anything other than those Pokemon or their pre evolutions. Fix the balance and make more Pokemon viable and the game will be infinitely better!

data.content:
This game was great when it came out, then fell down a bit thanks to the tracking getting messed up and the 'you're going too fast' thing, but now thankfully it is great again. The new feature spawns Pokemon at pokestops and shows which ones they are at, so you always know where to go to find specific ones you want. They sometimes still spawn in the wild anyway, so if you aren't near pokestops you can still find some however they will often be notably less rare, e.g. Pidgeys, eevees etc. 

Gen 2 is finally here, which is great as some of my favourite Pokemon like scizor, typhlosion and feraligatr will finally be catcheable. Got an elekid this morning from my 10k egg (noticed that these have become notably easier to obtain too). One thing that does irritate me is how rare fire types are in the UK, I've only ever caught one Ponyta in the wild, hatched two more and a magmar from eggs and still haven't got ONE charmander since the game came out!

Overall, Pokemon Go is obviously being improved lots and I will continue playing. I recommend it to anyone, whether they are the best competitive battlers or completely new to Pokemon and just want an excuse to go outside. This game is not dead! The only things I suggest adding are trading and breeding as my brother has an Aerodactyl while I have a lapras, and as I prefer Aero while he prefers lapras, it would be great if we could get them. Also if possible they could add an online trading feature, like the GTS in sun and moon, so I could get Kangaskhan, Tauros and farfetch'd and vice versa for others.  Btw Team Mystic Forever👌🏻❄️🌨

Edit: The new event with starters being more common has really helped me, as I have been able to finally catch some charmanders. Thanks for implementing this and I hope the game will continue to have occasional events like this one!
data.title: Mystic FTW

data.content:
"I want to be the very best like no one ever was"

Pokémon go unlike Pokémon console games doesn't allow you to be the very best for several reasons

Firstly the gym mechanics doesn't make you feel that you have the best Pokémon in the world but instead it makes you feel that you may have the best team(valor, mystic, instinct). This is because winning gym battles does not make you feel that you have achieved much from working on catching all those rare Pokémons, instead those who have alot of members on their team will "win".
Winning in pokemon go is a very small accomplishment since it literally takes no skill at all(yes you have to learn how to dodge and stuff) but it takes away the strategic part of the game away unlike the console Pokémon games where there are mindgames and prediction and alot of factors such as pokemon abilities and hax moves that will make the game more diverse.
Since the goal of Pokémon goal is to promote exercise, whats the point of that when there are  lesser and lesser people each day playing the game?
Promoting exercise is already accomplish from hatching eggs and catching Pokémon, and now in my opinion Pokémon go should now focus on making people actually enjoy playing the game.

This can be achieved by introducing new mechanics to the game which allows you to make more use of your pokemon such as PvP.
PvP allows people to believe that they are the very best and will introduce a new competitive sense to the game, it allows more people to spend time on the game and will increase the purpose of catching all those pokemons with high ivs which in turn will promote exercise due to more people will hatch more eggs in hope for a more competitive Pokémon. 

Add shiny Pokémon
Shiny hunting in the console game has been very popular since catching one will give you so much pride and in a sense will make you feel you are the very best in achieving what so little people have achieved if you have a shiny Pokémon 
Shiny hunting in console games takes a very long time and is also highly depending on luck
Pokémon go could use the shiny feature of Pokémon to their advantage to achieve their goals in promoting exercise since it will make people go mindless in hunting for all these  shinies 

My opinion on the current Pokémon go roadmap

If Niantic thinks that slowly adding new generations of pokemon will increase the number of players for the long run they are wrong

By the time they reach gen3 people will see the pattern of where this is going
It is true that some group if people will start to play the game again in hope for getting a mudkip or torchic but after they have their swampert or blaziken they will quit again 
This is because they will feel that there is no point catching these Pokémons if they are going to use them only for boring gym battles.

In order for more players to get into the game and keep on playing niantic needs to find a way to make the Pokémon people have caught more useful otherwise people will think that there is no point in catching all these strong pokemons

If John Hanke continues to follow his current road map for pokemon go it the game will eventually go downhill due to the reasons stated above
To fix this John needs to make the players feel committed in playing the game by introducing more fun features because catching Pokémon alone is not the fun aspect of the game but battling with it is.
data.title: My opinion on why Pokémon go is going downhill

data.content:
Having played this game since release, I have been continuously let down by the shoddy development.

Even now Dec 16' the game still crashes out, eggs start to hatch and disappear, the touch selection on the map is endlessly infuriating and catching Pokemon of any level with the "appropriate" pokeball is still largely pot luck.

Niantic have been very slow to fix bugs and have focused their efforts on wearables and other endeavours as opposed to the game.

The game is an overly simplistic entry to the Pokemon franchise and it's clear that niantic are only interested in the in-app purchases that players are making.

I played over the holiday break and have now deleted it from my phone, let's hope they see sense in the future and make the vast improvements the game deserves for the players that are still interested.

Absolutely disgraceful.
data.title: Boring, unimaginative cash cow

data.content: I live in a rural area. My nearest Pokestop is 15 mins walk away, the next one after that is another 15 mins - I'm looking at an hour's walk just to hit two Pokestops that never give out eggs and are extremely tight on the Pokeballs. As such it's very limiting what I can do on the game. I used to rely on "drive-by" Pokestops when I am a passenger in the car (husband driving) but thanks to the update, there's now a "speed limit" on the game meaning you can't use Pokestops over a certain speed and Pokémon don't spawn. This means I very rarely have any opportunity to play the game now. I have no Pokeballs left and no eggs, and now very few and far between chances to hit Pokestops to stock up. I have 18 month old twins so getting out and about isn't the easiest and frankly I can now no longer be bothered with Pokémon Go thanks to the update. No fun.
data.title: No good for non-city dwellers

data.content: My son and I have been playing Pokemon Go since July 2016. It is truly an amazing concept, beautifully delivered. We find ourselves almost obsessed with it and playing at every opportunity. At times when our interest has waned, updates have ensured that the game has become more interesting and complex. We particularly enjoy working towards evolving various characters and finding rare Pokemon. The less enjoyable parts of the game are being surrounded by fairly ordinary Pokemon such as Rattatas, Pidgeys and Spearows. Hatching eggs brings an extra dimension to the game and an element of surprise. Playing the game has enabled my son (aged 7) to develop his mental arithmetic skills and has also encouraged him to go out and be more adventurous in order to find new Pokemon. I would rate this game very highly - it's certainly the most enjoyable iPhone game I've ever tried.
data.title: Lots of fun for kids and adults alike

I think this will encourage more people to play as gyms fill up quickly

data.content:
I play this app almost on a daily basis as I've always enjoyed Pokémon games.

Also, there have been some great additions/updates over the last few months which I do recognise, like the individual pokemon appraisal system, the incentive to come back and play every day for bonuses/streaks, holiday events and improvements to whatever the find and catch system is called in the bottom right corner.

However, there's a long way to go. The game mostly feels empty as there's little opportunity to interact with other players and the main gameplay is very repetitive. The Pokémon gym mechanics need a total overhaul as it's too easy for a handful of people to takeover for an indefinite period of time, and the battling system is just awful. Please expand the space one must stand in to interact with the gyms and introduce more creative battling? An alternative PvP system would be welcome too.

Looking forward to trading, as well as Pokémon from the johto region and beyond!
data.title: Fun game but has yet to hit the mark
